808636E30C574AA1881DB48EBA8CA34D.description: A concrete poem creates an image with words or symbols that matches the topic of the poem.

518CD023E75442C69D608079F3A113D4.description: Free verse is a type of poetry that does not rhyme or have a regular rhythm.

7F2930F1389C4263BFFD3239B34E7801.description: Verse is text structured with a rhythm and typically has a rhyme.

69B04A2A6E2E43248D47A60E1BE4C6BF.description: Procedural texts include recipes or instruction manuals.

82FDFBA46E8A4C38B0916A1966F20FF0.description: First person is where the author, text creator, or narrator relates information from their own point of view, often using the word I.

85B89FAEBF41478CAC28378D988CE688.description: Point of view is the way an author or text creator chooses to tell or narrate a story and includes first person.

726A93CA19FE4D089178725C30EC2721.description: A minor character is a character in a story who is not the main focus and is less developed.

9D92ED8AAE974074A915C981C7DEF544.description: A fantasy is a fictional text that contains elements that are highly unreal.

F7EFEF845E1B45D9A9A0D2BA95CE3348.description: Fictional texts can be categorized by sub-genres, including traditional literature and fantasy.

9ACE1AEBC8304221A0AA3B2C887ECC4A.description: Narrative texts can be fiction or non-fiction and can follow a structure, including beginning, problem, events, solution and ending.

E61985C3EE6D43D1936563D002DBEA1C.description: A genre is a category of text that has a specific content or style and includes fiction and non-fiction.

63903DBFF9324FAF83C457442B844C06.description: Texts read for enjoyment can inspire, fascinate, or expand understandings.
